memberdef.name: createWidgetT

detaileddescription.para:
Create child widget
_style
Child, Popup or Overlapped widget style
_type
widget type
_skin
widget skin
_coord
int coordinates of widget (_left, _top, _width, _height)
_align
widget align (possible values can be found in enum Align)
_layer
layer where widget will be created (all layers usually defined in core_layer.xml file).
_name
optional widget name (you can use it for finding widget by name later)

memberdef.argsstring: (WidgetStyle _style, const std::string &_skin, const IntCoord &_coord, Align _align, const std::string &_layer="", const std::string &_name="")
memberdef.name: createWidget

detaileddescription.para: Same as Widget::createWidgetT but return T* instead of Widget*
Set widget position (position of left top corner)
Set widget size
Set widget position and size
See Widget::setPosition(const IntPoint& _pos)
See Widget::setSize(const IntSize& _size)
See Widget::setCoord(const IntCoord& _coord)
Set widget position (position of left top corner)
Set widget size
Set widget position and size
See Widget::setRealPosition(const FloatPoint& _point)
See Widget::setRealSize(const FloatSize& _size)
See Widget::setRealPosition(const FloatCoord& _coord)
Hide or show widget
Return true if visible
Return widget's visibility based on it's and parents visibility.
Set align
Get align
Set widget opacity
Get widget opacity

Enable or disable inherits alpha mode. Inherits alpha mode: when enabled widget alpha is it's own alpha value multiplied by parent's real alpha (that depend on parent's parent and so on). When disabled widget's alpha doesn't depend on parent's alpha. So this is used when you need things like semi-transparent window with non-transparent text on it and window's alpha changes. Enabled (true) by default.
Get inherits alpha mode flag
Is this widget is root widget (root == without parents)
Get parent widget or nullptr if no parent
Get child widgets Enumerator
Get child count
Get child by index (index from 0 to child_count - 1)

Find widget by name. Search recursively through all childs starting from this widget.
Return first found widget with given name
Find all widgets with given name and add them into _result. Search recursively through all childs starting from this widget.
Enable or disable widget
Enable or disable widget without changing widget's state
Is widget enabled
Is widget enabled and all it's parents in hierarchy is enabled.
Get rectangle where child widgets placed
Get client area widget or nullptr if widget don't have client

Detach widget from widgets hierarchy
_layer
Attach to specified layer (if any)

Attach widget to parent
_parent
New parent
_style
New widget style (see WidgetStyle::Enum)
_layer
Attach to specified layer (if any)
Change widget skin

Set widget style.
_style
New widget style (see WidgetStyle::Enum)
_layer
Attach to specified layer (if any)
When choosing WidgetStyle::Popup style you also need attach widget to layer
Get widget style

Set any widget property
_key
Property name (for example Alpha or Enabled)
_value
Value converted to string
